benchmark_details.name: MIDAS (Motivational Interviewing Dataset in Spanish)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces MIDAS, a counseling dataset created from public video sources that contains expert annotations for counseling reflections and questions, aiming to explore language-based differences in counselor behavior in English and Spanish.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a resource for NLP researchers working on mental health applications and explore counseling dynamics in different languages.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The collected transcripts are sourced from online videos created for educational purposes and may be scripted.

data.source: Public video sources from YouTube involving motivational interviewing.
data.annotation: Annotated by professional counselors with MI experience.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy and F1 Score calculated based on the classifier predictions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy and F1 scores indicate better classification of counselor behaviors.
methodology.validation: Interannotator reliability was evaluated achieving a 92% intraclass correlation for reflections and questions.
